---
title: 'Design tokens'
order: 1
navOrder: 4
mobileGlobalNav: true
category: 'develop'
subCategory: 'design-tokens'
customPath: '/develop/design-tokens'
---

<TextLayoutLeft>

A design token is a central location to store design related information such as colors, fonts, animations and so on. These raw values can then be transformed and be formatted to fit the needs of any platform.

</TextLayoutLeft>

<div class="if block light letterbox">
  <div class="if container left">
    <blockquote
      class="if"
      cite="https://css-tricks.com/what-are-design-tokens/"
    >
      <p class="if">
        “With design tokens, you can capture low-level values and then use them
        to create the styles for your product or app. You can maintain a
        scalable and consistent visual system for UI development.”
      </p>
      <footer class="if">
        —Robin Rendle, <cite class="if">What Are Design Tokens?</cite>
      </footer>
    </blockquote>
  </div>
</div>

## Introduction

### What are design tokens?

<div class="if text layout columns">
<div class="if text body">

Design tokens are all the values needed to construct and maintain a design system — spacing, color, typography, object styles, animation, etc. — represented as data. These can represent anything defined by design: a color as a RGB value, an opacity as a number, an animation ease as Bezier coordinates. They’re used in place of hard-coded values in order to ensure flexibility and unity across all product experiences.

</div>

<figure class="if">
<img src="/images/design-token-example.png" class="if" alt="Screenshot of some design tokens with relation" style="margin-left: auto;"/>

</figure>
</div>

### Naming convention

We are using a design token structure and naming convention [inspired by this article](https://medium.com/eightshapes-llc/naming-tokens-in-design-systems-9e86c7444676).

      </span>

## Design token types

### Global tokens

<div class="if text layout columns">
<div class="if text body">

Global tokens are the primitive values in our design language, represented by context-agnostic names. Our color palette, animation, typography, and dimension values are all recorded as global tokens. These can be directly used, and are inherited by all other token types.

</div>
<figure class="if">
<img src="/images/design-tokens-global.png" class="if" alt="Screenshot of some the global design token relation" style="margin-left: auto;"/>

</figure>
</div>

### Alias tokens

<div class="if text layout columns">
<div class="if text body">

Alias tokens relate to a specific context or abstraction. Aliases help communicate the intended purpose of a token, and are effective when a value with a single intent will appear in multiple places.

</div>
<figure class="if">
<img src="/images/design-tokens-alias.png" class="if" alt="Screenshot of some design tokens with relation" style="margin-left: auto;"/>

</figure>
</div>

### Component specific tokens

<div class="if text layout columns">
<div class="if text body">

Component-specific tokens are an exhaustive representation of every value associated with a component. They often inherit from alias tokens, but are named in a way that allows engineering teams to be as specific as possible in applying tokens in component development.

</div>
<figure class="if">
<img src="/images/design-tokens-component-specific.png" class="if" alt="Screenshot of some design tokens with relation" style="margin-left: auto;"/>

</figure>
</div>

## Global tokens {# specific-global-tokens}

<div class="if text layout columns">
<div class="if text body">

For more documentation about the global tokens, please see the respective documentation page:

- [Size, spacing, box-shadow, z-index, opacity](/components/utils/css)
- [Color](/components/color)
- [Breakpoints](/components/layout/breakpoint)
- [Icons, icon size](/components/media/icons)
- [Font-size, line-height, font-family](/components/text/typography)

</div>
</div>

### Size tokens

<div class="if text layout columns">
<div class="if text body">

Global size tokens are used for specifying dimensions and spacing for every If Design System component.

</div>
</div>

<figure class="if">
  <table class="if ids-doc" style="margin-bottom: 1rem;">

### Color

<div class="if text layout columns">
<div class="if text body">

Global color tokens are used as a base for color throughout the If Design System.

</div>
</div>

<figure class="if">
  <table class="if ids-doc" style="margin-bottom:1rem;">
    <thead class="if">
      <tr class="if">
        <th class="if">Name</th>
        <th class="if">Value</th>
        <th class="if">Example</th>
      </tr>
    </thead>
    <tbody class="if">
      <tr class="if">
        <td class="if">
          <span
            class="if design-token large color"
            data-value="#0054f0"
            data-hex="#0054f0"
          >
            <span class="if drop" style="background-color: #0054f0;"></span>$color-base-blue-100
            <code class="if">0054f0</code>
          </span>
        </td>
        <td class="if">
          <code class="language-scss">#0054f0</code>
        </td>
        <td class="if">
          <div
            class="if"
            style="height: 3rem; width: 100%; background-color:#0054f0;"
          ></div>
        </td>
      </tr>
      <tr class="if">
        <td class="if">
          <span
            class="if design-token large color"
            data-value="#6e625e"

## Component tokens

<TextLayoutLeft>

Component tokens are specific to given component only. The tokens can be override/used in themes with css variables.

</TextLayoutLeft>

<figure class="if">
  <table class="if ids-doc" style="margin-bottom:1rem;">
    <thead class="if">
      <tr class="if">
        <th class="if">Name</th>
        <th class="if">Value</th>
        <th class="if">Example</th>
      </tr>
    </thead>
    <tbody class="if">
      <tr class="if">
        <td class="if">
          <span
            class="if design-token color"
            data-value="rgb(110,98,94)"
            data-hex="#6e625e"
          >
            <span class="if drop" style="background-color: rgb(110,98,94);"></span>
            $ids-avatar-border-color
          </span>
        </td>
        <td class="if">
          <code class="language-scss">rgb(110,98,94)</code>
        </td>
        <td class="if">
          <div
            class="if"
            style="height: 2rem; width: 100%; background-color:rgb(110,98,94);"
          ></div>
        </td>
      </tr>
      <tr class="if">
        <td class="if">
          <span class="if design-token size" data-value="1rem">
            $ids-avatar-status-size-2
          </span>
        </td>
        <td class="if">
          <code class="language-scss">1rem</code>
        </td>
        <td class="if">
          <div
            class="if"
            style="height: 1rem; width: 1rem;border: 0.0625rem solid currentColor;"
          ></div>
        </td>
      </tr>
      <tr class="if">
        <td class="if">
          <span class="if design-token font-size" data-value="1.375rem">
            $ids-avatar-initials-font-size-3
          </span>
        </td>
        <td class="if">
          <code class="language-scss">1.375rem</code>
        </td>
        <td class="if">
          <div class="if" style="font-size: 1.375rem;">
            A
          </div>
        </td>
      </tr>
    </tbody>
  </table>
  <figcaption class="if caption"></figcaption>
</figure>
